alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Picayune, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Picayune and Mcneil. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 5 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
